data.title: Art and History
data.text: I usually visit the museum during Art Walk.  There are always very nice art works on display in other parts of the old courthouse.  The museum has a room to themselves on the first floor.  The displays change every 4-6 months.  All of the displays are of some historical significance to the county.  There have been some great displays about the Civil War, the oldest churches in the area and the present display about long time school teachers in the county.  Definitely worth a visit if your are a history nut.

data.title: Fun for art lovers
data.text:
I have been here a few times now.  I usually visit when it is the art walk and it is really pretty inside.  There is a lot of art work as in paintings, photography, pottery etc.  So far it has been mostly modern art which I am not a fan of but it is done by all local people and so it is a great way to support local arts, which I am all about!
 
 A few years back my mother in law and myself went during an art walk to view a free movie they were showing at this location.  If you go upstairs there is a big old theater and it was a lot of fun.  I believe they hold concerts and comedians come and magicians. 

 Also on the plus side is that it is free to get in! Great for the family. Maybe not little kids due to the pottery that they have sitting out and the paintings on the walls.  Nothing is covered.

data.title: A pleasant surprise
data.text: This attraction holds great memories of our City and County. The displays do change throughout the year and everything is displayed in a pleasant and dynamic way as to give the viewers that good look.

data.title: Our History at its best
data.text: Small but very meaningful for the visitor. Local history to the max with wonderful history added in.

data.title: Great little museum
data.text: The museum is located in a historic building that used to be the county court house. They have exhibits which change every few months. There is also a room with county history. The building is amazingly restored. The staff are warm and friendly. They have an ISPY game which challenges the children to be engaged throughout the exhibit. This is the type of place you can easily visit all throughout the year with a different experience. Best of all its completely free.
